https://www.gs1.org/standards/barcodes/e.title: UPC Number
https://www.gs1.org/standards/barcodes/e.description: UPC (aka UPC-A) consists of 12 numeric digits that are uniquely assigned to each trade item. Along with the related EAN barcode, the UPC is the barcode mainly used for scanning of trade items at the point of sale, per GS1 specifications.

https://www.pma.com/content/articles/201.title: PLU Number
https://www.pma.com/content/articles/201.description: PLUs are a system of numbers that uniquely identify bulk produce sold in grocery stores and supermarkets.

https://www.gs1.org/voc/gtin.title: GTIN Code
https://www.gs1.org/voc/gtin.description: Global Trade Item Number (GTIN) can be used by a company to uniquely identify all of its trade items.

https://www.gs1.org/voc/Product.description: Product details as specified in the Product.json schema

https://w3id.org/traceability/ChemicalPr.title: Chemical Property
https://w3id.org/traceability/ChemicalPr.description: A property, used to indicate attributes and relationships of some Thing; equivalent to rdf:Property.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/chebi/for.title: Formula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/chebi/for.description: A chemical formula is a way of presenting information about the chemical proportions of atoms that constitute a particular chemical compound or molecule, using chemical element symbols, numbers, and sometimes also other symbols, such as parentheses, dashes, brackets, commas and plus and minus signs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/chebi/inc.title: InChI
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/chebi/inc.description: The IUPAC International Chemical Identifier (InChI) is a textual identifier for chemical substances, designed to provide a standard way to encode molecular information and to facilitate the search for such information in databases and on the web.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/chebi/inc.title: InChIKey
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/chebi/inc.description: The condensed, 27 character InChIKey is a hashed version of the full InChI (using the SHA-256 algorithm), designed to allow for easy web searches of chemical compounds.

property.name: Rockwell Hardness Test (Scale A)
property.description: The Rockwell hardness test is an empirical indentation hardness test that can provide useful information about metallic materials.

property.name: Torque-controlled fatigue testing
property.description: ISO 1352:2011 specifies the conditions for performing torsional, constant-amplitude, nominally elastic stress fatigue tests on metallic specimens without deliberately introducing stress concentrations. The tests are carried out at ambient temperature (ideally at between 10 °C and 35 °C) in air by applying a pure couple to the specimen about its longitudinal axis.

property.name: Charpy Impact Strength Test
property.description: ISO 148-1:2016 specifies the Charpy (V-notch and U-notch) pendulum impact test method for determining the energy absorbed in an impact test of metallic materials. This part of ISO 148 does not cover instrumented impact testing, which is specified in ISO 14556.

property.name: Charpy Impact Strength Test
property.description: ISO 148-1:2016 specifies the Charpy (V-notch and U-notch) pendulum impact test method for determining the energy absorbed in an impact test of metallic materials. This part of ISO 148 does not cover instrumented impact testing, which is specified in ISO 14556.

property.name: Charpy Impact Strength Test
property.description: ISO 148-1:2016 specifies the Charpy (V-notch and U-notch) pendulum impact test method for determining the energy absorbed in an impact test of metallic materials. This part of ISO 148 does not cover instrumented impact testing, which is specified in ISO 14556.

property.name: Torque-controlled fatigue testing
property.description: ISO 1352:2011 specifies the conditions for performing torsional, constant-amplitude, nominally elastic stress fatigue tests on metallic specimens without deliberately introducing stress concentrations. The tests are carried out at ambient temperature (ideally at between 10 °C and 35 °C) in air by applying a pure couple to the specimen about its longitudinal axis.

property.name: Izod Impact Strength Test
property.description: ISO 180 defines the method used for pendulums to determine the impact resistance of a plastic specimen when supported in a cantilever configuration. Test results are used to evaluate the resilience of materials, typically plastics.

property.name: Rockwell Hardness Test (Scale A)
property.description: The Rockwell hardness test is an empirical indentation hardness test that can provide useful information about metallic materials.

property.name: Torque-controlled fatigue testing
property.description: ISO 1352:2011 specifies the conditions for performing torsional, constant-amplitude, nominally elastic stress fatigue tests on metallic specimens without deliberately introducing stress concentrations. The tests are carried out at ambient temperature (ideally at between 10 °C and 35 °C) in air by applying a pure couple to the specimen about its longitudinal axis.

https://schema.org/globalLocationNumber.title: Global Location Number (GLN)
https://schema.org/globalLocationNumber.description: A Global Location Number (GLN) is the GS1 Identification Key used to identify physical locations or parties. The key comprises a GS1 Company Prefix, Location Reference and Check Digit. For more information see http://www.gs1.org/gln.

schema.description: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical location.

globalLocationNumber.title: Global Location Number (GLN)

address.title: Postal Address

https://schema.org/PostalAddress.title: Postal Address
https://schema.org/PostalAddress.description: The location at which a particular organization or person may be found or reached.

https://gs1.org/voc/organizationName.title: Organization Name
https://gs1.org/voc/organizationName.description: The name of the organization expressed in text.

https://schema.org/streetAddress.title: Street Address
https://schema.org/streetAddress.description: The street address expressed as free form text. The street address is printed on paper as the first lines below the name. For example, the name of the street and the number in the street or the name of a building.

https://schema.org/addressLocality.title: Address Locality
https://schema.org/addressLocality.description: Text specifying the name of the locality, for example a city.

https://schema.org/addressRegion.title: Address Region
https://schema.org/addressRegion.description: Text specifying a province or state in abbreviated format for example NJ.

https://schema.org/addressCountry.title: Address Country
https://schema.org/addressCountry.description: Code specifying the country (and country subdivision) for the address using ISO 3166-1.

https://gs1.org/voc/crossStreet.title: Cross Street
https://gs1.org/voc/crossStreet.description: A street intersecting a main street (usually at right angles) and continuing on both sides of it.

https://gs1.org/voc/countyCode.title: County Code
https://gs1.org/voc/countyCode.description: A code that identifies a county. A county is a territorial division in some countries, forming the chief unit of local administration. In the US, a county is a political and administrative division of a state.

https://schema.org/postalCode.title: Postal Code
https://schema.org/postalCode.description: Text specifying the postal code for an address.

https://schema.org/postOfficeBoxNumber.title: Post Office Box Number
https://schema.org/postOfficeBoxNumber.description: The number that identifies a PO box. A PO box is a box in a post office or other postal service location assigned to an organization where postal items may be kept.
